title: If God created the universe, then who created God? And who created the creator of God? - Quora

response.answer_text: First you have to understand where this concept came from, as it has only existed for a few thousand years and records of civilizations go back many many times more years than that. In the primal days we grasped at theory’s to explain our world as we do now. One such theory they came up with with their limited perception and prehistoric intelligence is that there is always a beginning and an end. Pah, Infinity is not a concept most humans are capable of grasping even today! Another prehistoric law of nature is that nothing exists without being created, which to them with their limited perceptions was easily proven. For an animal was created through fornication, not thin air, plants from seeds, pots by humans, et cetera. In actuality; as we now know; these things only cause the process to start and that which makes up the whole is taken from the environment around the entity, animals eat plants and other animals while plants eat the stuff in the soil and pots are made from the stuff in the soil and all things go back to the soil. The hypothesis that there is a beginning and an end is obviously disproven by this law, because if it were true then there would have been a time when nothing existed and something had to create it. In your statement God is defined as a thing which by definition can and did always exist. Therefore they imagined a thing that by definition defies nature (is not limited in any way by it) something outside of it that we cannot imagine so that it can be the ultimate originator of all things so that their clearly disproven hypothesis can be maintained as a theory. We now know that matter cannot be created or destroyed, there is no beginning nor end for anything it is all simply matter changing forms. If that is true (which has been proven) then there is no beginning to existence. Existence; the multiverse; is infinite, matter always existed and always will exist. Therefore there can be no creator of existence, although like a man creating a pot there was something that started the process that created our universe. Another concept difficult for people to understand is natural cause and effect, as opposed to intelligent design. With their limited perceptions people have thought that because they are aware of their actions and making choices that the pot, the hut, et cetera is an intelligent design. Because we think this way, everything must be in this way, for they cannot imagine anything existing in another way than it does in their own perception. Is a hurricane created by the evaporation of hot air rising in the atmosphere (which has been proven) or because God made it appear to punish the wicked Floridians? Volcanos, earthquakes, tornados, et cetera we now know how they come into being naturally, but we once thought it happened magically at God (or the gods) whim. But the truth is our choices are no different from waters choice to erode a cliffside. We are of nature, our molecules form a particular pattern which forms us in a particular way. We are a much more complex series of molecules than water or acid, more than even the processes that create the horrors of nature, but we are still of nature and interact with it in the way our molecular alignment dictates. Everything is natural cause and effect, nothing is created through intelligent design. So if this god is real, and he did intentionally cause the creation of our universe to begin, he is a being of this existence (though perhaps vastly more complex than we can imagine) and interacted with it in a natural way to produce the outcome of the birth of a universe in one of the ways universes continue to bang into being and crunch out of being (though the matter is really just changing form). We humans have worshiped (were thankful for) the sun, the moon, the north star, the Earth itself, and this made sense because we didn’t even realize outer space existed (there was also a time we didnt even realize the planet existed) and only perceived what happened within visual range as existing. We can now see distant planets, we understand outer space’s existence, so worshipping something so small and familiar seems primitive. So it seems we now worship whatever natural phenomenon caused the big bang of our universe, and of course as we did with the sun (Ra, Sol, etc), our planet (Gaia, Terra, etc), the moon (Selene, Luna, etc), and the north star (Lucifer, Tou Mu, etc) we have personified it (as we personify everything, with our limited ability to imagine things other than ourselves existing) and associated a philosophy with it. As the creator of our universe this natural event created all things within it. All other gods are personifications of all these things existing within our universe therefore He created all other gods (angels, demons, etc) before us. The reality lines up with the train of thought (diluted with personification though it may be) explained by religion.
